originalText.text:
When my father fell ill, walking was his weakness. He started getting check-up with Nurses and PT from Riverside Premier Rehabilitation at home, I’ve seen great progress. The Nurses and PT has been so caring and understanding towards my father recovery, and also making sure he’s taking his medications.
We are happy, continue to do great work.

We are happy, continue to do great work.

originalText.text: My dad came from a different rehab and it was an absolute horrible experience. But switching my dad here, I was nervous again, however this was a major difference, the service here is exceptional. My dad was in another rehab for nearly a month and made no progress and was just withering away and could not stand ( he fractured the back of his skull and it affected his cognitive but he also has PTSD from falling). But here, it has been a month already and he is speaking better and able to stand at least. Everyone is so warm no matter what position they are, even upon leaving their shift so freaking nice. And what impressed me the most is that they take the time to actually get to know my dad and knows how to handle him and not once have they been mean nor neglectful. Although my dad can be combative at times, but now he has adjusted and is making progress and I am happy with him here and the people he has around him. I was here every single day. But now, if I have things to take care of I don’t feel as worried or nervous as before in not seeing him for a day or so. I know he is in good hands. I just want to thank everyone here at Riverside for their amazing service I know the job can get hard at times. It you guys are appreciated!! I should have made you guys my first choice so we wouldn’t have to go through any negative experience. Thank you for making this positive and hopeful for my dad.

originalText.text:
They are friendly, attentive and informative.

Zuida Williams is amazing gets the job done and encourages the patient and ensures the family feels safe and comfortable.

The only thing I would recommend is more attentive to phones for when loved ones try to get in contact.

originalText.text: I have finally returned back home today after about a 2 month stay at The Riverside. I initially couldn’t get out of bed but today, with the help of a walker, I confidently stepped back into my apartment. This wasn’t my first time staying here and my second stay has been even more enjoyable than my first. The Concierge Erby has been an absolute pleasure to have helping me during my stay, he is such a sweet kid and has just the best disposition. He even came with me to get settled back in at home! Thank you to the Riverside, Erby, and the fantastic Rehab staff they employ!

originalText.text: My grandfather is a resident here and we will be placing him elsewhere as soon as we can get a spot (have a tour of two other communities on Monday and are planning on bringing him home to my sisters house if we don’t have a new guaranteed spot by Tuesday - it’s that urgently bad here). The staffing ratio is INSANELY low so if you send your loved one here, just know that the company will not adhere to any promises of ensuring their safety. All of the good nurses we loved have left because management decided to slash their pay (in the midst of a healthcare worker shortage crisis nonetheless), so you can be guaranteed you will NOT get quality care here.
